items.sentence: Read the kind of books that are useful to you.
I'm visiting a friend of mine in the hospital.
Tom will moving to his new house next weekend.
I wonder if Tom knows Mary can't speak French.
I know that Tom won't like the stew Mary made.
I know Tom won't like the stew that Mary made.
I knew that Tom wasn't going to wait for Mary.
I don't think that Tom is as stubborn as Mary.
How did Tom know Mary wasn't going to be here?
Tom wrote a letter of recommendation for Mary.
Tom was in the hospital for most of last year.
You did that in Boston last month, didn't you?
You agreed that we should do that, didn't you?
We're fortunate that we're allowed to do that.
Unfortunately, I was stupid enough to do that.
There's no way I'm going to do that by myself.
No one wants to do that, but one of us has to.
Just thinking about doing that makes me tired.
It's important to do that every day, isn't it?
It'll take you at least three days to do that.
